metadata.title: How is transnationalism “transnationalized”? The intercultural transfer of contemporary Peruvian narratives
metadata.author: N/A

content.full_text:
How is transnationalism “transnationalized”? The intercultural transfer of contemporary Peruvian narratives
How is transnationalism “transnationalized”? The intercultural transfer of contemporary Peruvian narratives
A Data Management Plan created using DMPonline.be
Creator: 
Creator: 
Erwin Snauwaert
Affiliation:

KU Leuven (KUL)

Project abstract:
Project abstract:
Although transnationalism is one of the most prominent perspectives from which Latin American literature has been studied in recent decades, to date
the resonance of this concept in a broader intercultural scope has hardly been addressed. Starting form five narratives written by contemporary Peruvian
authors (Bayly, Bryce Echenique, Cueto, Roncagliolo, and Vargas Llosa), we will analyse how the (trans)national images outlined in the originals
evolve in the translations  into hypercentral, central and peripheral languages (respectively English, French, and Dutch) as well as, from an
“intersemiotic” viewpoint, into cinematographic adaptations. By connecting these aspects to the reception of the corresponding works in the
aforementioned literary systems,  the project aims to demonstrate how the transnational projection all these writers share is perceived in a transnational
context. This perspective will shed light on the position of Peruvian literature in the broader literary system as well as on the dynamics between the
cultures involved in the intercultural transfer.
Last modified: 
Last modified: 
18-03-2024
